tool.name: Line/Word/Character count
tool.command:
#set $word_to_arg = { 'characters':'m', 'words':'w', 'lines':'l' } #set $arg_order = [ 'lines', 'words', 'characters' ] #if not isinstance( $options.value, list ): #set global $args = [ $options.value ] #else: #set global $args = $options.value #end if #if $include_header.value echo "#${ "\t".join( [ i for i in $arg_order if i in $args ] ) }" > $out_file1 && #end if
##Handle compressed (fastq) input #if $input1.is_of_type("fastq.gz"): zcat '$input1' | #else if $input1.is_of_type("fastq.bz2"): bzcat '$input1' | #else: cat '$input1' | #end if wc #for $option in $args: -${ word_to_arg[ str(option) ] } #end for | awk '{ print ${ '"\\t"'.join( [ "$%i" % ( i+1 ) for i in range( len( $args ) ) ] ) } }' >> $out_file1

validator.message: You must pick at least one attribute to count.

tool.help:
**What it does**
This tool outputs counts of specified attributes (lines, words, characters) of a dataset.
-----
**Example Output**
::
#lines words characters 7499 41376 624971
------
**Citation**
If you use this tool in Galaxy, please cite Blankenberg D, et al. *In preparation.*
